1: <sup>1</sup> Then answered Bildad the Shuhite, and said,
2: <sup>2</sup> How long wilt thou speak these things? and how long shall the words of thy mouth be like a strong wind?
3: <sup>3</sup> Doth God pervert judgment? or doth the Almighty pervert justice?
4: <sup>4</sup> If thy children have sinned against him, and he have cast them away for their transgression;
5: <sup>5</sup> If thou wouldest seek unto God betimes, and make thy supplication to the Almighty;
6: <sup>6</sup> If thou wert pure and upright; surely now he would awake for thee, and make the habitation of thy righteousness prosperous.
7: <sup>7</sup> Though thy beginning was small, yet thy latter end should greatly increase.
8: <sup>8</sup> For enquire, I pray thee, of the former age, and prepare thyself to the search of their fathers:
9: <sup>9</sup> (For we are but of yesterday, and know nothing, because our days upon earth are a shadow:)
10: <sup>10</sup> Shall not they teach thee, and tell thee, and utter words out of their heart?
11: <sup>11</sup> Can the rush grow up without mire? can the flag grow without water?
12: <sup>12</sup> Whilst it is yet in his greenness, and not cut down, it withereth before any other herb.
13: <sup>13</sup> So are the paths of all that forget God; and the hypocrite’s hope shall perish:
14: <sup>14</sup> Whose hope shall be cut off, and whose trust shall be a spider’s web.
15: <sup>15</sup> He shall lean upon his house, but it shall not stand: he shall hold it fast, but it shall not endure.
16: <sup>16</sup> He is green before the sun, and his branch shooteth forth in his garden.
17: <sup>17</sup> His roots are wrapped about the heap, and seeth the place of stones.
18: <sup>18</sup> If he destroy him from his place, then it shall deny him, saying, I have not seen thee.
19: <sup>19</sup> Behold, this is the joy of his way, and out of the earth shall others grow.
20: <sup>20</sup> Behold, God will not cast away a perfect man, neither will he help the evil doers:
21: <sup>21</sup> Till he fill thy mouth with laughing, and thy lips with rejoicing.
22: <sup>22</sup> They that hate thee shall be clothed with shame; and the dwelling place of the wicked shall come to nought.
